intro: Acetosella platypila, commonly known as the purple alpine mouse-ear, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its low-growing habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Acetosella platypila thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plant collections.
